Title:
Daedalea americana sp. nov. (Polyporales, Basidiomycota)
evidenced by morphological characters and phylogenetic analysis
Keywords:
brown-rot fungi, Fomitopsidaceae, phylogeny, polypore,
taxonomy
Abstract:
A new polypore, Daedalea americana, collected from North
and Central America, is described and illustrated based on morphological
characters and molecular evidence. It is characterized by annual and
pileate basidiocarps, flesh-pink to brown when fresh, concentrically
zonate pileus with brown to cinnamon brown band, cream to clay-pink pore
surface, circular to angular pores (4â“5 per mm) and ellipsoid
basidiospores (4.0â“5.1 Â´ 2.1â“3.0 Âµm). Phylogenetic analysis based on
the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) regions and nuclear large subunit
(nLSU) ribosomal RNA gene regions supported D. americana as a
distinctive new species belonging to Daedalea.
